snippet: The men were tried by a secretive court, and a report released Friday contradicted the police, who said in April that all 10 had been sentenced to 25 years.
abstract: Pakistani officials say court has released eight of 10 Taliban gunmen who were accused of conspiring in 2012 attack on schoolgirl activist Malala Yousafzai, who survived and went on to receive Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 for her advocacy for education of girls.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The men were tried by a secretive court, and a report released Friday contradicted the police, who said in April that all 10 had been sentenced to 25 years.

headline.main: Pakistan Says Court Has Freed 8 of 10 Accused in Attack on Malala Yousafzai
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Sets 8 of 10 Free in Shooting of Schoolgirl
